result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Grace Bosanac was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Heather Grace Bosanac
parties.address: 11116 West Wildwood Lane #302, West Allis, WI 53227

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 12/5/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT to any sentence with credit for 61 days served; Huber privileges.  Release to the Day Reporting Center. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request:
CANCELLATION OF HUBER / WORK RELEASE / ELECTRONIC SURVEILLANCE PRIVILEGES PURSUANT TO WISCONSIN STATUTES SECTION 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4).
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge ASHLEY, Br 33, for review.
Order denying defendant's request for additional release privileges, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carl Ashley, Br. 33, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.
GRANTING request for release privileges, signed and filed. lms
Letter Requesting Additional Information To Be Added to the June 03, 2015 Huber Privileges Motion.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Ellen R. Brostrom, Br. 6, for review. jbs
MOTION TO CLARIFY HUBER LAW PRIVILEGES WITH ATTACHED ORDER received.
from the defendant and Jacalyn B., received and filed. lms

Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any sentence with credit for 61 days served; Huber privileges.  Release to the Day Reporting Center. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. 

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 12/5/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
Received and Filed, Milwaukee County Arrest- Detention Report.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in br. 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

DTC - PHASE IV
Review Hearing proceeds.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant may be issued new charged.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Heather Grace Bosanac not in court, in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Defendant not produced, counsel waives appearance for hearing.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Per email from case manager.  Case is adjourned from 4/30/2015 to 4/23/2015 at 2:30pm. lms

Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

DTC - PHASE IV
Review Hearing proceeds.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract. SANCTION: Court orders 4 days in jail. Report by 4/17/2015 by 2:00 pm. Then revert back to PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.  No points are awarded.  Sobriety date to be reset.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

DTC - PHASE IV
Review Hearing proceeds. Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program.  Court withheld 1 point.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6. FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Per email from case manager.  Case is adjourned from 4/30/2015 to 4/9/2015 at 2:30pm. lms

Defendant request to modify the no contact order is denied.

Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the St/ate of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  OFF THE RECORD.  Due to scheduling conflict with defense counsels calendar on 6/18/2014, Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 6 on 6/19/2014.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 6/18/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms
(future court date is cancelled)

Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Karen A Loebel for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant has completed the TAD evaluation and is on the waiting list for the drug treatment court.  Defense moves to adjourn 45 to 60 days.  Court denies motion.  State moves to transfer case to Br. 06 to be resolved with pending case in that court.  Attorney Meylink states Br. 06 is aware of this case.  Court transfers case to Br. 06 subject to Judge Brostrom accepting this case.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in court with attorney Daniel E. Meylink.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/14/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no drug paraphernalia.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in court with attorney Daniel E. Meylink.  Defendant Heather Grace Bosanac in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
